results.title: Country Outcasts
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Peter Johnson and David Roberts
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Frontiers downunder”.
Country outcasts is a small pop band made up from a number of talented Aborigines who have spent their lives in a wholly urbanised environment. This film is the story of a tour that this band makes through the outback, and the thoughts and feelings that are aroused within these city dwellers when they meet their trivialised brothers in Central Australia.

results.title: Country of Islam
results.creator_credit: Churchill-Wexler Film Productions and Gunther V. Fritsch
results.brief_description: Provides a glimpse of the culture, economy and religion of Morocco as seen through the eyes of Mustafa, a Moslem boy who leaves his village home and journeys to a city to seek an education.

results.title: Country line dancing
results.brief_description: Country Line Dancing, or Bootscooting, made easy for everyone. Instructor Diane Horner of “Cowboy” in Minneapolis Minnesota demonstrates the 40 basic dance steps used in line dancing. Dances demonstrated include Electric Slide, Country Strut, Southside Shuffle, Cowboy Cha Cha, Achy Breaky, Slap Leather, Tush Push and the circle dance, Cotton Eyed Joe, plus the special bonus, Sixteen Step. The first 30 minute part is followed by more complex instructions.

results.title: Country life
results.creator_credit: ABC-TV (Australia), Griffith University, Asian Studies Council and Maija Rove
results.brief_description:
Episode number 6 of Series “Dragon’s tongue”.
This video looks at life in the country in China. It is part of a television series on Chinese language and culture with an emphasis on communication. The video includes an interview with a Chinese duck farmer, a look at Chinese script (the seasons) and short dramas in Chinese. Interview questions are repeated and shown in Chinese script, Pin Yin, and English.

results.title: Country Kids
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “PGR Series”.
Colin talks to mothers about their reactions to living in small isolated communities such as those serviced by the Australian national train “The Tea and Sugar”. Paula talks to a representative of RICE and local women about the benefits of the Community Service van, which travels with the train. PGR also looks at life on an isolated sheep station, and we listen to the stories of some of the women to arrive in

results.title: Country gardens
results.creator_credit: Perennial Productions, Stuart Crowner and Bruce Franchini
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Gardens of the world”.
The pleasure of a country garden - heavy with smell, taste and touch - has captured the imagination of artists and poets for centuries. Audrey Hepburn explores several of the world’s most beautiful country gardens, among them, the romantic Giardino del Ninfa, south of Rome; charming cottage gardens in England; the farmhouse gardens surrounding Chilcombe House in Dorset. Narrated by Michael York.

results.title: Country fairs
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Fernand Dansereau, Victor Jobin and Jean Roy
results.brief_description: For farm folk it is a day of judgment, for town folk a day of fun, in the Eastern Townships of Quebec. Drum majorettes and cattle shows, pipes and drums and homemade pickles - the country fair has something for everyone, and in this film the probing camera is everywhere to capture its essence to the full.
